paperstack.data package#

Submodules#

paperstack.data.library module#

Provides Library database class.

class paperstack.data.library.Library(config)#

Bases: object

Library class. This is in charge of communicating with the database and creating Record instances.

Parameters

config (paperstack.filesystem.config.Config) – Config instance.

config#

Config instance.

Type

paperstack.filesystem.config.Config

data_dir#

The directory where library data will be stored.

Type

paperstack.filesystem.file.File

connection#
Type

sqlite3.Connection

add(record)#

Use record SQL export to add to library.

Parameters

record (paperstack.data.record.Record) –

close()#

Close connection to library database.

commit()#

Commit a change to the database.

connect()#

Connect to sqlite3 library database.

filter(filters)#

Select all items satisfying filters and build records.

Parameters

filters (list) – Each filter is a tuple with (field, query).

remove(record_id)#

Remove record using record ID.

Parameters

record_id (int) –

update(arg)#

paperstack.data.record module#

Module providing Record base data class.

class paperstack.data.record.Article(record)#

Bases: paperstack.data.record.Record

Article record for academic papers.

Parameters

record (dict) – The entries of the record.

setup()#

Set up requirements according to record type.

to_sql()#

Export to SQL (SQL insert command).

exception paperstack.data.record.InvalidRecord(message=None)#

Bases: Exception

A catchall exception for invalid records.

message#
Type

str

Parameters

message (str) –

class paperstack.data.record.Record(record, record_type)#

Bases: object

Library record handling validation. This is the most basic data class in the program. Database information will be deserialized into this. Each Record instance will be in charge of its own BibTeX entry when exporting.

Parameters

  • record (dict) – The entries of the record.

  • record_type ({'article', 'book', 'website'}) – The type of record.

record#

The entries of the record.

Type

dict

record_type#

The type of record.

Type

{‘article’, ‘book’, ‘website’}

requirements#

A list of requirement tuples.

Type

list

add_requirement(field, field_type, required=True, pattern=None)#

Add a field requirement.

Parameters

  • field (str) – Which field to add requirement to

  • field_type (any) – Python type of field

  • required (bool, optional) – Whether field must exist

  • pattern (str, optional) – RegEx pattern for field if type is str

setup()#

Set up requirements according to record type.

to_sql()#

Export to SQL (SQL insert command).

validate()#

Validate record according to requirements. Fields can be marked as required and constraints can be placed based on type and pattern matching.

Raises

InvalidRecord – Raised when a requirement is not met in the record.
